Basically we are South Indian Brahmins hailing originally from Thanjavur. Since there is no seperate language categorization for my mother tongue while registering the profile, I wanted to mention mother tongue in this manner: ' Kannada / Tamil.' I have entered Kannada as my mother tongue since only one language can be mentioned; but some language has to be mentioned. I could have equally entered Tamil too as my mother tongue. There is no arrangement to mention both Kannada & Tamil as my mother tongue. We factually speak Thanjavur Marathi at home, which is different from the usual Marathi spoken in Maharashtra. But having been brought up in Mumbai since birth, I have studied the regional language Marathi & know to read & speak. Thanjavur Marathi is a mixture of Sanskrit, Old Marathi, Kannada & Tamil words. Hence I know both the languages Kannada & Tamil & can understand little Malayalam & Telugu as well. People from our community are miniscule in number. It is common in our community to make matrimonial alliances with Kannada & Tamil (Iyer / Iyengar) speaking Brahmins, & Kannada / Tamil (Iyer / Iyengar) speaking Brahmins also do not hesitate to give their sons or daughters in marriage with our community, so much so that some of our relatives are speaking Kannada / Tamil at home as their mother tongue because we share a common religion, culture, tradition, customs & practices as South Indian Brahmins with regard to celebration of festivals or conducting thread ceremony or marriage ceremony etc.

I believe in chemistry. Either two people meet and feel a connection or they don't. Two perfectly nice, attractive people may not necessarily be attracted to each other. If there is no chemistry you cannot force it to be there. I am a loving, kind, and generous person. I believe that two people in a relationship are each, at least partially, responsible for the other's happiness. I say what I mean and mean what I say. I don't make promises I do not intend to keep. I don't believe in mind games or power struggles or manipulation or control. These things are toxic to a relationships. I want someone who will be my best friend, and I will be her. Someone to laugh and be silly with and who will be there for me, as I would for her, if I cry. Someone who will genuinely care about my well being and does not always put her own needs and concerns first.

Marriage happens only once. That is what I personally believe in. When both the players have deep respect for the marriage institute, play the game with fare intention; solemnly follow set of rules without looking beyond each other. When you learn to live harmoniously with your better half, you grow, mingle and dissolve together evolving into a homogeneous entity forming a perfect concoction  called ÃÂ¢Ãâ¬ÃËsoulmatesÃÂ¢Ãâ¬Ãâ¢. My late wife was a charismatic, beautiful, sensible and an intelligent lady whom I searched in the crowd after a great toil. But a personal tragedy took her away in the prime of her life.
Life has to go on and it is only one life you are endowed with of which you are conscious of. The concept of HOME is incomplete without a woman and I believe that a woman is an axis around which the entire house revolves and the lives of its occupants are woven. 

On a positive note, a second chance make you more sensitive towards life and one really learns that all those small and seemingly insignificant moments of life which passed unnoticed/overlooked were of tremendous importance when one pauses, stands and stares and absorbs them with a lovely smile. Your whole perspective of life gets a complete overhaul. 

Relationships are always to be worked out and need time to mature.

Describing me myself is not that important. When it comes to describe oneself it is a tremendous task. One can choose so many catchy adjectives for self description. I have passion for rain and canÃÂ¢Ãâ¬Ãâ¢t resist the temptation of walking in rain. I feel like melting in rain.
I have been practicing Yoga for the past 30 years. I love to go for trekking and undertake walks for miles.
